title: 108_hr2472
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Budget Autonomy Act of 2003" amends Section 446 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act regarding the enactment of the local budget. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the budget adopted must be submitted to the President for transmission to Congress. The Council must adopt the annual budget for the District of Columbia government within 50 days of receiving the proposal from the Mayor. Any supplements must also be adopted after a public hearing. In control years, the budget adopted must be submitted to the President for transmission to Congress. No amount may be obligated or expended by any officer or employee of the District of Columbia government unless approved by an Act of Congress. After the annual budget is adopted, reprogramming of amounts in the budget can only occur if the Mayor submits a request to the Council. Amounts cannot be obligated or expended without approval by an Act of Congress. The Mayor must request reprogramming of budget amounts to the Council for approval, with any additional expenditures offset by reductions in another activity. The term 'control year' is defined in the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995. Congressional review period for budget acts is also addressed in the amendment. The amendment addresses the Congressional review period for budget acts, specifying that Acts not in a control year will take effect after a 30-day period unless a joint resolution disapproving the Act is enacted into law within that time. The joint resolution disapproving an Act must be enacted into law within a 30-day period, which can be extended by 5 additional days under certain circumstances. If the resolution passes both Houses of Congress within the applicable period, the Act will be disapproved. The joint resolution disapproving an Act, if passed by both Houses of Congress and signed by the President within the applicable period, will repeal the Act. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Act to reflect this change. The Act is amended in various sections to reflect changes made by a joint resolution disapproving it. The National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997 is amended in section 11206 by changing references from "the fourth sentence of section 446" to "section 446(c)". Additionally, a clerical amendment is made to update the table of contents to reflect this change. SEC. 446 of the National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997 pertains to the enactment of local budgets. SEC. 3 addresses the action by the Council of the District of Columbia on line-item vetoes by the Mayor of provisions of budget acts. Section 404(f) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to change the wording regarding transmission of documents to the President of the United States. Additionally, there are conforming amendments made to this section. The District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to define the term 'control year' in section 305(4). SEC. 4 of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to allow employees to be hired if the position is authorized by the Council. SEC. 5 includes other amendments related to changes in the federal role in the budget process. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended to give federal authority over the budget-making process for control years. During control years, the Council and Mayor must adhere to the established financial plan and budget. The definition of 'control year' in the District of Columbia Financial Responsibility and Management Assistance Act of 1995 is amended to align with the budget-making process during control years. SEC. 6 of the Act states that any general provision in an appropriation bill for Federal payments to the District of Columbia will remain in effect until the enactment of a new bill for the following fiscal year. SEC. 7 specifies the effective date of the Act. The amendments made by this Act will apply to the District of Columbia's budgets for fiscal years starting on or after October 1, 2004.
